title: Function-Based Mathematical Modeling Microlearning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic functions, ability to analyze linear/nonlinear relationships, and basic mobile device proficiency
context.additional_context: Project-based learning focused on solving real-life problems (e.g., taxi-bike fare calculations) through function modeling.

learning_goals: Learners can generate function models by applying the three stages (formulate-employed-interpret/evaluate) of the PISA framework’s mathematical modeling cycle
Learners can convert and interpret real-life problems (e.g., taxi-bike fare systems) presented in mobile environments into function equations/graphs
Learners can evaluate the validity of mathematical models and propose improvements based on peer feedback

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
